snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo dismissed the official, Steven Kuhr, after learning that Mr. Kuhr deployed government workers to clear a tree from his driveway during the hurricane.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo dismisses Steven Kuhr, director of the State Office of Emergency Management, New York's counterpart to the Federal Emergency Management Agency; Kuhr is believed to have deployed government workers to clear a tree from his Long Island driveway during Hurricane Sandy, a time when work crews were in high demand; officials have called Kuhr's action an abuse of power.

byline.contributor: Angela Macropoulos contributed reporting from Massapequa, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo dismissed the official, Steven Kuhr, after learning that Mr. Kuhr deployed government workers to clear a tree from his driveway during the hurricane.

headline.seo: Cuomo Fires New York’s Emergency Management Chief
headline.main: Cuomo Fires Emergency Office Chief for Misusing Workers in Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Fires Emergency Office Chief for Misusing Workers in Hurricane
